doc.title: phylip

description.text: PHYLIP is a package of programs for inferring phylogenies.

doc.reference: Felsenstein, J. 1993. PHYLIP (Phylogeny Inference Package) version 3.5c. Distributed by the author. Department of Genetics, University of Washington, Seattle.
Felsenstein, J. 1989. PHYLIP -- Phylogeny Inference Package (Version 3.2). Cladistics 5: 164-166.

comment.text: This program uses the compatibility method for unrooted two-state characters to obtain the largest cliques of characters and the trees which they suggest.

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

div.div:
Example data (click on [use example data] to load):
5 6 Alpha 110110 Beta 110000 Gamma 100110 Delta 001001 Epsilon 001110

xhtml:div.label:
Use ancestral states in input file (A)?
Yes No
There should also be, in the input file after the numbers of species and characters, an A on the first line of the file. There must also be, before the character data, a line or lines giving the ancestral states for each character. It will look like the data for a species (the ancestor). It must start with the letter A in the first column. There then follow enough characters or blanks to complete the full length of a species name (e. g. ANCESTOR). Then the states which are ancestral for the individual characters follow. These may be 0, 1 or ?, the latter indicating that the ancestral state is unknown.
Examples:
ANCESTOR 0010011
Specify minimum clique size? (C) Yes No

label.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.label:
Minimum clique size?
This option indicates that you wish to specify a minimum clique size and print out all cliques (and their associated trees) greater than or equal to than that size.
Analyze multiple data sets (M) Yes No

label.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.label: How many data sets (D)
Compute a consensus tree Yes No
Sites weighted? (W) Yes No
Analyze multiple data Weigths (M) Yes No

label.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.label: How many sets of weights?

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.label: Print out compatibility matrix (3) Yes No

Print out tree (4)?
Yes No
Tells the program to print a semi-graphical picture of the tree in the outfile.

Write out trees onto tree file (5)?
Yes No
Tells the program to save the tree in a treefile (a standard representation of trees where the tree is specified by a nested pairs of parentheses, enclosing names and separated by commas).
Print out the data at start of run (1) Yes No

interface.label: Specify minimum clique size? (C) Yes No

message.text: You must enter a numeric value, greater than or equal to 0

div.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

format.code: ($value )? " && cp infile clique.infile && cp clique.outtree intree && consense <consense.params && mv outtree consense.outtree && mv outfile consense.outfile" : ""
( "", " && cp infile clique.infile && cp clique.outtree intree && consense <consense.params && mv outtree consense.outtree && mv outfile consense.outfile" )[ value ]
